result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install/Violate Court Order

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher M Tuttle

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Jade K Hall in court with Christopher M Tuttle.  Attorney Samuel E. Simpson in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Discovery and offer received.  Defense request a plea and sentencing date.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 12, 2023 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Christopher M Tuttle in court.  Attorney Jade K Hall in court for Christopher M Tuttle.  Attorney Samuel E. Simpson in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for an ARRAIGNMENT.  However, a Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Crivello, Branch 36.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Swanson, Br. 11.  Court advised defendant that conditions of bail remain in full force effect.  Case adjourned for scheduling in Branch 11, Rm 608 CH.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Attorney Jade Hall

Defendant Christopher M Tuttle in court.  Attorney Katherine Graber in court on behalf of Jade K Hall for Christopher M Tuttle.  Attorney Alexandria Carlson in court on behalf of Samuel E. Simpson for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in Court for Arraignment. Defense counsel is in trial in another branch and would like to be present for the arraignment. Defense requested adjournment of proceedings. State does not object. Court grants request. Defendant is advised that all bail conditions remains in full force and effect.  Case remains calendared in Branch 36.
Arraignment scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Christopher M Tuttle in court in person with Attorney Jade K Hall who appears by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Crivello, Branch 36.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel. Defense requests an arraignment date. Case is adjourned to Branch 36.  Arraignment scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 8-2-2022

Defendant Christopher M Tuttle in court in person.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for preliminary hearing. States witness is present. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. State requests that this matter be set in the trial court for a State V. Lee hearing; denied.  Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.
  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY with breathalyzer tests and SCRAM.
  No possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription.
  Court ordered random drug testing.

Defendant Christopher M Tuttle in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Defendant Christopher M Tuttle in custody.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
